register.description: CPSW PORT 0 control register

bitfield.description: Port 0 DLR CPDMA Channel This field indicates the CPDMA channel that DLR packets will be received on.
Port 0 Pass Priority Tagged 0 - Priority tagged packets have the zero VID replaced with the input port P0_PORT_VLAN [11:0] 1 - Priority tagged packets are processed unchanged.
Port 0 VLAN LTYPE 2 enable 0 - disabled 1 - enabled
Port 0 VLAN LTYPE 1 enable 0 - disabled 1 - enabled

Port 0 DSCP Priority Enable 0 - DSCP priority disabled 1 - DSCP priority enabled. All non-tagged IPV4 packets have their received packet priority determined by mapping the 6 TOS bits through the port DSCP priority mapping registers.

register.description: CPSW PORT 0 maximum FIFO blocks register

bitfield.description: Transmit FIFO Maximum Blocks - This value is the maximum number of 1k memory blocks that may be allocated to the FIFO's logical transmit priority queues. 0x10 is the recommended value of P0_TX_MAX_BLKS. Port 0 should remain in flow control mode. 0xE is the minimum value P0_TX_MAX_BLKS.

Receive FIFO Maximum Blocks - This value is the maximum number of 1k memory blocks that may be allocated to the FIFO's logical receive queue. 0x4 is the recommended value. 0x3 is the minimum value P0_RX_MAX_BLKS and 0x6 is the maximum value.

register.description: CPSW PORT 0 FIFO block usage count (read only)

bitfield.description: Port 0 Transmit Block Count Usage - This value is the number of blocks allocated to the FIFO logical transmit queues.
Port 0 Receive Block Count Usage - This value is the number of blocks allocated to the FIFO logical receive queues.

register.description: CPSW PORT 0 transmit FIFO control

bitfield.description: Transmit FIFO Input Rate Enable

Transmit FIFO Input Queue Type Select 00 - Normal priority mode 01 - Dual MAC mode 10 - Rate Limit mode 11 - reserved Note that Dual MAC mode is not compatible with escalation or shaping because dual MAC mode forces round robin priority on FIFO egress. Rate-limiting and shaping are still available for Port 1 and Port 2 when Port 0 is set in dual MAC mode.
Transmit FIFO Input Blocks to subtract in dual MAC mode
Transmit FIFO Words in queue

register.description: CPSW PORT 0 VLAN register

bitfield.description: Port VLAN Priority (7 is highest priority)
Port CFI bit
Port VLAN ID

register.description: CPSW PORT 0 TX header priority to switch priority mapping register

bitfield.description: Priority 7 - A packet header priority of 0x7 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 6 - A packet header priority of 0x6 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 5 - A packet header priority of 0x5 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 4 - A packet header priority of 0x4 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 3 - A packet header priority of 0x3 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 2 - A packet header priority of 0x2 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 1 - A packet header priority of 0x1 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 0 - A packet header priority of 0x0 is given this switch queue priority.

register.description: CPSW CPDMA TX (PORT 0 RX) packet priority to header priority

bitfield.description: Priority 7 - A packet pri of 0x7 is mapped (changed) to this header packet priority.
Priority 6 - A packet pri of 0x6 is mapped (changed) to this header packet priority.
Priority 5 - A packet pri of 0x5 is mapped (changed) to this header packet priority.
Priority 4 - A packet pri of 0x4 is mapped (changed) to this header packet priority.
Priority 3 - A packet pri of 0x3 is mapped (changed) to this header packet priority.
Priority 2 - A packet pri of 0x2 is mapped (changed) to this header packet priority.
Priority 1 - A packet pri of 0x1 is mapped (changed) to this header packet priority.
Priority 0 - A packet pri of 0x0 is mapped (changed) to this header packet priority.

register.description: CPSW CPDMA RX (PORT 0 TX) switch priority to DMA channel

bitfield.description: Port 2 Priority 3 packets go to this CPDMA Rx Channel
Port 2 Priority 2 packets go to this CPDMA Rx Channel
Port 2 Priority 1 packets go to this CPDMA Rx Channel
Port 2 Priority 0 packets go to this CPDMA Rx Channel
Port 1 Priority 3 packets go to this CPDMA Rx Channel
Port 1 Priority 2 packets go to this CPDMA Rx Channel
Port 1 Priority 1 packets go to this CPDMA Rx Channel
Port 1 Priority 0 packets go to this CPDMA Rx Channel

register.description: CPSW PORT 0 RX DSCP priority to RX packet mapping reg 0

bitfield.description: Priority 7 - A packet TOS of 0d7 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 6 - A packet TOS of 0d6 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 5 - A packet TOS of 0d5 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 4 - A packet TOS of 0d4 is mapped to this received packet priority.

Priority 0 - A packet TOS of 0d0 is mapped to this received packet priority.

bitfield.description: Priority 55 - A packet TOS of 0d55 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 54 - A packet TOS of 0d54 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 53 - A packet TOS of 0d53 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 52 - A packet TOS of 0d52 is mapped to this received packet priority.

Priority 48 - A packet TOS of 0d48 is mapped to this received packet priority.

register.description: CPSW PORT 0 RX DSCP priority to RX packet mapping reg 7

bitfield.description: Priority 63 - A packet TOS of 0d63 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 62 - A packet TOS of 0d62 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 61 - A packet TOS of 0d61 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 60 - A packet TOS of 0d60 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 59 - A packet TOS of 0d59 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 58 - A packet TOS of 0d58 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 57 - A packet TOS of 0d57 is mapped to this received packet priority.
Priority 56 - A packet TOS of 0d56 is mapped to this received packet priority.

register.description: Port 0 EEE Idle to LPI Counter Load Value Register

bitfield.description: Port 0 EEE Idle to LPI counter load value - After CLKSTOP_REQ is asserted, this value is loaded into the port 0 idle to LPI counter on each clock that the port 0 transmit is not idle. Port 0 enters the transmit LPI state when this counter decrements to zero. This counter decrements each time the EEE prescale counter decrements to zero.

register.description: Port 0 EEE LPI to Wake Counter Load Value Register

bitfield.description: Port 0 EEE LPI to wake counter load value – When the port is in the transmit LPI state and the CLKSTOP_REQ signal is deasserted, this value is loaded into the port 0 LPI to wake counter. Transmit packet operations may begin (resume) when the LPI to wake count decrements to zero (on the pre-scale count). This is the time that the CPDMA transmit must wait before transmit (switch ingress) packet operations begin (resume after wakeup).

register.description: CPSW PORT 1 control register

bitfield.description: Port 1 Transmit clockstop enable 0 – RGMII transmit clockstop not enabled 1 – RGMII transmit clockstop enabled. The transmit clock will be stopped after the LPI state is entered (and indicated to the CPRGMII) and the P1_Idle2LPI time is counted (counter value reused). The P1_Idle2LPI counter value must be greater than 9 transmit clocks (slowest clock)
Port 1 Pass Priority Tagged 0 - Priority tagged packets have the zero VID replaced with the input port P1_PORT_VLAN [11:0] 1 - Priority tagged packets are processed unchanged.
Port 1 VLAN LTYPE 2 enable 0 - disabled 1 - VLAN LTYPE2 enabled on transmit and receive
Port 1 VLAN LTYPE 1 enable 0 - disabled 1 - VLAN LTYPE1 enabled on transmit and receive

Port 1 DSCP Priority Enable 0 - DSCP priority disabled 1 - DSCP priority enabled. All non-tagged IPV4 packets have their received packet priority determined by mapping the 6 TOS bits through the port DSCP priority mapping registers.
Port 1 Time Sync Destination IP Address 107 enable 0 – disabled 1 – destination IP address (dec) 224.0.0.107 is enabled.
Port 1 Time Sync Destination Port Number 320 enable 0 - disabled 1 - Annex D (UDP/IPv4) time sync packet destination port number 320 (decimal) is enabled.
Port 1 Time Sync Destination Port Number 319 enable 0 - disabled 1 - Annex D (UDP/IPv4) time sync packet destination port number 319 (decimal) is enabled.
Port 1 Time Sync Destination IP Address 132 enable 0 - disabled 1 - Annex D (UDP/IPv4) time sync packet destination IP address number 132 (decimal) is enabled.
Port 1 Time Sync Destination IP Address 131 enable 0 - disabled 1 - Annex D (UDP/IPv4) time sync packet destination IP address number 131 (decimal) is enabled.
Port 1 Time Sync Destination IP Address 130 enable 0 - disabled 1 - Annex D (UDP/IPv4) time sync packet destination IP address number 130 (decimal) is enabled.
Port 1 Time Sync Destination IP Address 129 enable 0 - disabled 1 - Annex D (UDP/IPv4) time sync packet destination IP address number 129 (decimal) is enabled.
Port 1 Time Sync Time To Live Non-zero enable. 0 = TTL must be zero. 1 = TTL may be any value.
Port 1 Time Sync Unicast Enable 0 – Unicast disabled 1 – Unicast enabled
Port 1 Time Sync Annex F enable 0 – Annex F disabled 1 – Annex F enabled
Port 1 Time Sync Annex E enable 0 – Annex E disabled 1 – Annex E enabled
Port 1 Time Sync Annex D enable 0 - Annex D disabled 1 - Annex D enabled
Port 1 Time Sync LTYPE 2 enable 0 - disabled 1 - enabled
Port 1 Time Sync LTYPE 1 enable 0 - disabled 1 - enabled
Port 1 Time Sync Transmit Enable 0 - disabled 1 - enabled
Port 1 Time Sync Receive Enable 0 - Port 1 Receive Time Sync disabled 1 - Port 1 Receive Time Sync enabled

register.description: CPSW PORT 1 maximum FIFO blocks register

bitfield.description: Transmit FIFO Maximum Blocks - This value is the maximum number of 1k memory blocks that may be allocated to the FIFO's logical transmit priority queues. 0x11 is the recommended value of P1_TX_MAX_BLKS unless the port is in fullduplex flow control mode. In flow control mode, the P1_RX_MAX_BLKS will need to increase in order to accept the required run out in fullduplex mode. This value will need to decrease by the amount of increase in P1_RX_MAX_BLKS. 0xE is the minimum value for P1_TX_MAX_BLKS.

Receive FIFO Maximum Blocks - This value is the maximum number of 1k memory blocks that may be allocated to the FIFO's logical receive queue. This value must be greater than or equal to 0x3. It should be increased In fullduplex flow control mode to 0x5 or 0x6 depending on the required runout space. The P1_TX_MAX_BLKS value must be decreased by the amount of increase in P1_RX_MAX_BLKS. 0x6 is the maximum value for P1_RX_MAX_BLKS.

register.description: CPSW PORT 1 FIFO block usage count (read only)

bitfield.description: Port 1 Transmit Block Count Usage - This value is the number of blocks allocated to the FIFO logical transmit queues.
Port 1 Receive Block Count Usage - This value is the number of blocks allocated to the FIFO logical receive queues.

register.description: CPSW PORT 1 transmit FIFO control

bitfield.description: Transmit FIFO Blocks that must be free before a non rate-limited CPDMA channel can begin sending a packet to the FIFO.
Transmit FIFO Input Rate Enable
Transmit FIFO Input Queue Type Select 0x0 - Normal priority mode 0x1 - reserved 0x2 - Rate Limit mode 0x3 - reserved
Transmit FIFO Input blocks to subtract on non rate-limited traffic in rate limit mode.
Transmit FIFO Words in queue

register.description: CPSW PORT 1 VLAN register

bitfield.description: Port VLAN Priority (7 is highest priority)
Port CFI bit
Port VLAN ID

register.description: CPSW PORT 1 TX header priority to switch priority mapping register

bitfield.description: Priority 7 - A packet header priority of 0x7 is given this switch queue priority
Priority 6 - A packet header priority of 0x6 is given this switch queue priority
Priority 5 - A packet header priority of 0x5 is given this switch queue priority
Priority 4 - A packet header priority of 0x4 is given this switch queue priority
Priority 3 - A packet header priority of 0x3 is given this switch queue priority
Priority 2 - A packet header priority of 0x2 is given this switch queue priority
Priority 1 - A packet header priority of 0x1 is given this switch queue priority
Priority 0 - A packet header priority of 0x0 is given this switch queue priority

register.description: CPSW PORT 1 time sync sequence ID offset and message type.

bitfield.description: Port 1 Time Sync Sequence ID Offset This is the number of octets that the sequence ID is offset in the tx and rx time sync message header. The minimum value is 6.
Port 1 Time Sync Message Type Enable - Each bit in this field enables the corresponding message type in receive and transmit time sync messages (Bit 0 enables message type 0 etc.).

register.description: CPSW CPGMAC_SL1 source address low register

bitfield.description: Source Address Lower 8 bits (byte 0)
Source Address bits 15:8 (byte 1)

register.description: CPSW CPGMAC_SL1 source address high register

bitfield.description: Source Address bits 23:16 (byte 2)
Source Address bits 31:24 (byte 3)
Source Address bits 39:32 (byte 4)
Source Address bits 47:40 (byte 5)

register.description: CPSW PORT 1 transmit queue send percentages

bitfield.description: Priority 3 Transmit Percentage - This percentage value is sent from FIFO priority 3 (maximum) whenCPSW_PTYPE[18] P1_PRI3_SHAPE_EN is set (queue shaping enabled). This is the percentage of the wire that packets from priority 3 receive (which includes interpacket gap and preamble bytes). If shaping is enabled on this queue then this value must be between zero and 0d100 (not inclusive).

Priority 2 Transmit Percentage - This percentage value is sent from FIFO priority 2 (maximum) whenCPSW_PTYPE[17] P1_PRI2_SHAPE_EN is set (queue shaping enabled). This is the percentage of the wire that packets from priority 2 receive (which includes interpacket gap and preamble bytes). If shaping is enabled on this queue then this value must be between zero and 0d100 (not inclusive).

Priority 1 Transmit Percentage - This percentage value is sent from FIFO priority 1 (maximum) when theCPSW_PTYPE[16] P1_PRI1_SHAPE_EN is set (queue shaping enabled). This is the percentage of the wire that packets from priority 1 receive (which includes interpacket gap and preamble bytes). If shaping is enabled on this queue then this value must be between zero and 0d100 (not inclusive).

bitfield.description: Priority 7 - A packet TOS of 0d7 is mapped to this received packet priority.

register.description: Port 1 EEE Idle to LPI Counter Load Value Register

bitfield.description: Port 1 EEE Idle to LPI counter load value - After CLKSTOP_REQ is asserted, this value is loaded into the port 1 idle to LPI counter on each clock that the port 1 transmit is not idle. Port 0 enters the transmit LPI state when this counter decrements to zero. This counter decrements each time the EEE prescale counter decrements to zero.

register.description: Port 1 EEE LPI to Wake Counter Load Value Register

bitfield.description: Port 1 EEE LPI to wake counter load value – When the port is in the transmit LPI state and the CLKSTOP_REQ signal is deasserted, this value is loaded into the port 1 LPI to wake counter. Transmit packet operations may begin (resume) when the LPI to wake count decrements to zero (on the pre-scale count). This is the time that the CPDMA transmit must wait before transmit (switch ingress) packet operations begin (resume after wakeup).

register.description: CPSW_3GF PORT 2 control register

bitfield.description: Port 2 Transmit clockstop enable 0 – RGMII transmit clockstop not enabled 1 – RGMII transmit clockstop enabled. The transmit clock will be stopped after the LPI state is entered (and indicated to the CPRGMII) and the P2_Idle2LPI time is counted (counter value reused). The P2_Idle2LPI counter value must be greater than 9 transmit clocks (slowest clock)
Port 2 Pass Priority Tagged 0 - Priority tagged packets have the zero VID replaced with the input port P2_PORT_VLAN [11:0] 1 - Priority tagged packets are processed unchanged.
Port 2 VLAN LTYPE 2 enable 0 - disabled 1 - VLAN LTYPE2 enabled on transmit and receive
Port 2 VLAN LTYPE 1 enable 0 - disabled 1 - VLAN LTYPE1 enabled on transmit and receive

Port 0 DSCP Priority Enable 0 - DSCP priority disabled 1 - DSCP priority enabled. All non-tagged IPV4 packets have their received packet priority determined by mapping the 6 TOS bits through the port DSCP priority mapping registers.
Port 2 Time Sync Destination IP Address 107 enable 0 – disabled 1 – destination IP address (dec) 224.0.0.107 is enabled.
Port 2 Time Sync Destination Port Number 320 enable 0 - disabled 1 - Annex D (UDP/IPv4) time sync packet destination port number 320 (decimal) is enabled.
Port 2 Time Sync Destination Port Number 319 enable 0 - disabled 1 - Annex D (UDP/IPv4) time sync packet destination port number 319 (decimal) is enabled.
Port 2 Time Sync Destination IP Address 132 enable 0 - disabled 1 - Annex D (UDP/IPv4) time sync packet destination IP address number 132 (decimal) is enabled.
Port 2 Time Sync Destination IP Address 131 enable 0 - disabled 1 - Annex D (UDP/IPv4) time sync packet destination IP address number 131 (decimal) is enabled.
Port 2 Time Sync Destination IP Address 130 enable 0 - disabled 1 - Annex D (UDP/IPv4) time sync packet destination IP address number 130 (decimal) is enabled.
Port 2 Time Sync Destination IP Address 129 enable 0 - disabled 1 - Annex D (UDP/IPv4) time sync packet destination IP address number 129 (decimal) is enabled.
Port 2 Time Sync Time To Live Non-zero enable. 0 = TTL must be zero. 1 = TTL may be any value.
Port 2 Time Sync Unicast Enable 0 – Unicast disabled 1 – Unicast enabled
Port 2 Time Sync Annex F enable 0 – Annex F disabled 1 – Annex F enabled
Port 2 Time Sync Annex E enable 0 – Annex E disabled 1 – Annex E enabled
Port 2 Time Sync Annex D enable 0 - Annex D disabled 1 - Annex D enabled
Port 2 Time Sync LTYPE 2 enable 0 - disabled 1 - enabled
Port 2 Time Sync LTYPE 1 enable 0 - disabled 1 - enabled
Port 2 Time Sync Transmit Enable 0 - disabled 1 - enabled
Port 2 Time Sync Receive Enable 0 - Port 1 Receive Time Sync disabled 1 - Port 1 Receive Time Sync enabled

register.description: CPSW PORT 2 maximum FIFO blocks register

bitfield.description: Transmit FIFO Maximum Blocks - This value is the maximum number of 1k memory blocks that may be allocated to the FIFO's logical transmit priority queues. 0x11 is the recommended value of P2_TX_MAX_BLKS unless the port is in fullduplex flow control mode. In flow control mode, the P2_RX_MAX_BLKS will need to increase in order to accept the required run out in fullduplex mode. This value will need to decrease by the amount of increase in P2_RX_MAX_BLKS. 0xE is the minimum value P2_TX_MAX_BLKS.

Receive FIFO Maximum Blocks - This value is the maximum number of 1k memory blocks that may be allocated to the FIFO's logical receive queue. This value must be greater than or equal to 0x3. It should be increased In fullduplex flow control mode to 0x5 or 0x6 depending on the required runout space. The P2_TX_MAX_BLKS value must be decreased by the amount of increase in P2_RX_MAX_BLKS. 0x3 is the minimum value P2_RX_MAX_BLKS and 0x6 is the maximum value.

register.description: CPSW PORT 2 FIFO block usage count (read only)

bitfield.description: Port 2 Transmit Block Count Usage - This value is the number of blocks allocated to the FIFO logical transmit queues.
Port 2 Receive Block Count Usage - This value is the number of blocks allocated to the FIFO logical receive queues.

register.description: CPSW PORT 2 transmit FIFO control

bitfield.description: Transmit FIFO Blocks that must be free before a non rate-limited CPDMA channel can begin sending a packet to the FIFO.
Transmit FIFO Input Rate Enable
Transmit FIFO Input Queue Type Select 0x0 - Normal priority mode 0x1 - reserved 0x2 - Rate Limit mode 0x3 - reserved
Transmit FIFO Input blocks to subtract on non rate-limited traffic in rate limit mode.
Transmit FIFO Words in queue

register.description: CPSW PORT 2 VLAN register

bitfield.description: Port VLAN Priority (7 is highest priority)
Port CFI bit
Port VLAN ID

register.description: CPSW PORT 2 TX header priority to switch priority mapping register

bitfield.description: Priority 7 - A packet header priority of 0x7 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 6 - A packet header priority of 0x6 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 5 - A packet header priority of 0x5 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 4 - A packet header priority of 0x4 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 3 - A packet header priority of 0x3 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 2 - A packet header priority of 0x2 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 1 - A packet header priority of 0x1 is given this switch queue priority.
Priority 0 - A packet header priority of 0x0 is given this switch queue priority.

register.description: CPSW_3GF PORT 2 time sync sequence ID offset and message type.

bitfield.description: Port 2 Time Sync Sequence ID Offset This is the number of octets that the sequence ID is offset in the tx and rx time sync message header. The minimum value is 6.
Port 2 Time Sync Message Type Enable - Each bit in this field enables the corresponding message type in receive and transmit time sync messages (Bit 0 enables message type 0 etc.).

register.description: CPSW CPGMAC_SL2 source address low register

bitfield.description: Source Address Lower 8 bits (byte 0)
Source Address bits 15:8 (byte 1)

register.description: CPSW CPGMAC_SL2 source address high register

bitfield.description: Source Address bits 23:16 (byte 2)
Source Address bits 31:23 (byte 3)
Source Address bits 39:32 (byte 4)
Source Address bits 47:40 (byte 5)

register.description: CPSW PORT 2 transmit queue send percentages

bitfield.description: Priority 3 Transmit Percentage - This percentage value is sent from FIFO priority 3 (maximum) when theCPSW_PTYPE[21] P2_PRI3_SHAPE_EN is set (queue shaping enabled). This is the percentage of the wire that packets from priority 3 receive (which includes interpacket gap and preamble bytes). If shaping is enabled on this queue then this value must be between zero and 0d100 (not inclusive).

Priority 2 Transmit Percentage - This percentage value is sent from FIFO priority 2 (maximum) when theCPSW_PTYPE[20] P2_PRI2_SHAPE_EN is set (queue shaping enabled). This is the percentage of the wire that packets from priority 2 receive (which includes interpacket gap and preamble bytes). If shaping is enabled on this queue then this value must be between zero and 0d100 (not inclusive).

Priority 1 Transmit Percentage - This percentage value is sent from FIFO priority 1 (maximum) when theCPSW_PTYPE[19] P2_PRI1_SHAPE_EN is set (queue shaping enabled). This is the percentage of the wire that packets from priority 1 receive (which includes interpacket gap and preamble bytes). If shaping is enabled on this queue then this value must be between zero and 0d100 (not inclusive).

register.description: Port 2 EEE Idle to LPI Counter Load Value Register

bitfield.description: Port 2 EEE Idle to LPI counter load value - After CLKSTOP_REQ is asserted, this value is loaded into the port 2 idle to LPI counter on each clock that the port 2 transmit is not idle. Port 2 enters the transmit LPI state when this counter decrements to zero. This counter decrements each time the EEE prescale counter decrements to zero.

register.description: Port 2 EEE LPI to Wake Counter Load Value Register

bitfield.description: Port 2 EEE LPI to wake counter load value – When the port is in the transmit LPI state and the CLKSTOP_REQ signal is deasserted, this value is loaded into the port 2 LPI to wake counter. Transmit packet operations may begin (resume) when the LPI to wake count decrements to zero (on the pre-scale count). This is the time that the CPDMA transmit must wait before transmit (switch ingress) packet operations begin (resume after wakeup).
